title: AfD success sparks panic among European Jews - The Jerusalem Post
message:
The success of German extremists in Sunday’s European Parliament election has mainstream Jewish leaders and politicians worried.
The strong showing for far-right parties reflects worries about increasing numbers of Muslim refugees since 2015 in Germany.
The Alternative for Germany Party stresses isolationism, takes an anti-EU and pro-Russian stance, and is accused of fomenting anti-Muslim sentiment.
Italy, France and Germany saw significant gains for far-right parties; such parties came in first in five out of the 27 member countries and second or third in five other countries.
AfD second to CDUIn Sunday’s election, the AfD came in second to Germany’s center-right Christian Democratic Union and its more conservative Bavarian sister party, the Christian Social Union.

title: Success of German far - right party in EU election has many Jews hearing echoes of Nazi past
message:
By Toby Axelrod June 11, 2024BERLIN — The success of German extremists in Sunday’s European Parliament election has mainstream Jewish leaders and politicians worried.
The strong showing for far-right parties reflects worries about increasing numbers of Muslim refugees since 2015 in Germany.
The Alternative for Germany Party stresses isolationism, takes an anti-EU and pro-Russian stance, and is accused of fomenting anti-Muslim sentiment.
Italy, France and Germany saw significant gains for far-right parties; such parties came in first in five out of the 27 member countries and second or third in five other countries.
In Sunday’s election, the AfD came in second to Germany’s center-right Christian Democratic Union and its more conservative Bavarian sister party, the Christian Social Union.
